info.title: OrbitXPay Corporate API
info.description:
This API is designed for managing the functionalities of **OrbitXPay**.

## Authentication

The API uses **Bearer Token** authentication. All requests to secured endpoints must include the following header:

```
Authorization: Bearer <your-token>
```

### How to Obtain the Token
1. Authenticate by sending a request to the **`/auth/signin-email`** OR **`/auth/signin-social`** OR **`/auth/signin`** endpoint.
2. Upon successful authentication, you will receive a Bearer token.

### Error Responses
- **`401 Unauthorized`**: Returned if the token is missing, invalid, or expired.
- **`403 Forbidden`**: Returned if the token does not have sufficient permissions to access the requested resource.

---

For further details, refer to individual endpoints.

UnauthorizedError.description: Access is denied due to invalid or missing token.

message.example: Unauthorized access. Token is missing or invalid.

InternalServerError.description: An unexpected error occurred on the server.

message.example: Something went wrong on the server. Please try again later.
You are not authorized to access this resource. Please log in again.

post.summary: Sign in using permanent verification code.
post.description:
This API allows users to sign in using a permanent  verification code.   
- The permanent verification code (**authToken**) is issued to the user via the **signup** API after successfully registration.  
- The user must provide this verification code (**authToken**) to authenticate.  
- If the code is valid, the API will issue an **accessToken** and **refreshToken**.  
- If the system has 2FA enabled for the user, the API will return a **token2fa** instead of the usual **accessToken** and **refreshToken**.  
- The user must complete the 2FA process to obtain access and refresh tokens.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to Specifies the application version.

schema.description: Partner code of this user.
Application code used for validating application-based requests.

post.description:
This API is used to register a new user in the system. Upon successful registration:
- The request requires the **x-app-code** header for authentication and the Partner Code to associate the customer to a particular partner.
- An email containing a verification link is sent to the provided email address.
- The user must click the verification link to confirm their email address.
- Until the email is verified, the account will remain inactive.
- To verify the email, the user needs to call the **Verify Email API** with the verification token sent in the email.


**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to Specifies the application version.

schema.description: Partner code of this user.
Application code used for validating application-based requests.

200.description: User registered successfully, email verification link sent

value.message: One or more required fields are missing

put.description:
This API is used to verify the email address of a user after they click the verification link in their email. 
The user must provide the verification token received in their email.

Upon successful verification:
- The user's email is marked as verified in the system.
- The account will be activated.
- A **temporary token** will be generated and returned.
- This temporary token is required to create the user’s password in the next step.
       
If the token is invalid or expired:
- The user will receive an error response indicating the failure.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to Specifies the application version.

schema.description: Partner code of this user.
Application code used for validating application-based requests.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The verification token sent via email

value.message: No email accociated with this token

post.summary: Sign in using email and password
post.description:
This API allows users to sign in using their email and password after verifying their email and creating a password.  
- On successful authentication, the API provides an **accessToken** and a **refreshToken** for subsequent requests.  
- If the system has 2FA enabled for the user, the API will provide a temporary token (**token2fa**) instead of the usual tokens.  
- The user must then complete the 2FA process to obtain access and refresh tokens.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to Specifies the application version.

schema.description: Partner code of this user.
Application code used for validating application-based requests.

post.description:
This API allows users to sign in using their Google account.  
- The user needs to authenticate via Google and provide the **accessToken** returned by Google.  
- The API will validate the **accessToken** with Google and authenticate the user.  
- If the system has 2FA enabled for the user, the API will provide a **token2fa** instead of the usual **accessToken** and **refreshToken**.  
- The user must complete the 2FA process to obtain access and refresh tokens.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to Specifies the application version.

schema.description: Partner code of this user.
Application code used for validating application-based requests.

post.description:
This API allows the user to sign out by invalidating the current `accessToken` and `refreshToken`.  
- The user will be logged out, and the tokens will no longer be valid.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to Specifies the application version.

schema.description: Partner code of this user.
Application code used for validating application-based requests.

put.description:
This API allows the user to obtain a new access token and refresh token.
- The user must provide a valid refresh token to get a new access token.
- This process ensures that the user's session can continue without needing to sign in again.

**Headers**:

- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to Specifies the application version.

schema.description: Partner code of this user.
Application code used for validating application-based requests.

post.description:
This API verifies the 2FA during the login process.
- After successfully logging in with email/password or social sign-in, if 2FA is enabled, the user must provide the 2FA token.
- The user needs to provide the OTP (One-Time Password) from their authenticator app to complete the login process.
- The 2FA token is verified and if successful, the user is granted access and provided with JWT tokens (accessToken, refreshToken).

**Headers**:

- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to Specifies the application version.

schema.description: Partner code of this user.
Application code used for validating application-based requests.

token2fa.description:
Encrypted token containing the user data for 2FA.
This is used to validate the 2FA during login.

otp.description:
The one-time password (OTP) generated by the authenticator app (e.g., Google Authenticator).
This is required to complete the 2FA verification process.

accessToken.description: JWT access token that the user can use for subsequent requests.

refreshToken.description: JWT refresh token used to get a new access token after expiration.

get.description:
Initializes Geetest CAPTCHA by returning the configuration required to render it on the frontend.

This public endpoint does **not** require authentication but needs specific headers to determine the partner and application context.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner making the request.
- **x-app-code**: Authenticates the app initiating the CAPTCHA challenge.

post.description:
Validate Geetest CAPTCHA by returning the configuration required to render it on the frontend.

This public endpoint does **not** require authentication but needs specific headers to determine the partner and application context.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner making the request.
- **x-app-code**: Authenticates the app initiating the CAPTCHA challenge.

get.summary: Generate 2FA secret key and QR code for the user
get.description:
This API generates a new 2FA secret key for the user, which can be used with an authenticator app (e.g., Google Authenticator).
It also returns the QR code data as a Base64 string, which can be scanned by the authenticator app.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate mobile-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Version of the client application making the request.

schema.description: Partner code of this user.

post.summary: Initiate the application process for corporate customers
post.description:
This API is used to initiate the application process for corporate customers.

Workflow:
- The API accepts the initial details required to start the corporate customer application.
- Once initiated, the system assigns a unique application ID and marks the application as pending further inputs.

Key Notes:
- This process is specific to corporate customers.
- The application will require further steps to complete, such as uploading documents, filling additional details, etc.
- Notifications or progress updates will be sent to the user’s registered email or dashboard.

Upon successful initiation:
- The API returns the unique application ID and status.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to Specifies the application version.

schema.description: Partner code of this user.
Application code used for validating application-based requests.

put.summary: Update details of a corporate customer application
put.description:
This API is used to update the details of an existing corporate customer application.

Workflow:
- Provide the unique application ID and the updated fields.
- Only editable fields can be modified;

Key Notes:
- The application must exist in the system.
- If the application is already submitted for review, updates will be restricted.

Upon successful update:
- The application details are updated, and the new data is stored in the system.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to Specifies the application version.

- Returns detailed information about the application, including the status and all submitted details.
- If the `id` does not exist, the API will return an appropriate error message.

patch.summary: Perform a partial update on a corporate customer application
patch.description:
This API is used for partial updates to a corporate customer application.
Specifically, it allows removing **one representative** and/or **one ultimate beneficial owner (UBO)** from an existing application.

Workflow:
- Provide the unique **id** along with a single **representative** or **ultimateBeneficialOwner** to be removed.

Key Notes:
- If the application is already submitted for review, updates will be restricted.
- Only one **representative** and/or one **ultimateBeneficialOwner** can be removed at a time..
- Fields provided in the request body will be removed only; other application details remain unaffected.
- The API only removes existing entries. If a provided entry does not exist, the API will return an error.

Upon successful update:
- The specified entry (representative or UBO) is removed from the application.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to Specifies the application version.

schema.description: Partner code of this user.
Application code used for validating application-based requests.

requestBody.description: Partial update data to remove representatives or ultimate Beneficial Owners

representativeId.description: The ID of the representative to remove

uboId.description: The ID of the ultimate beneficial owner to remove *

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid input or missing required fields.

value.message: Error occurred while retrieving KYB information.
Error occurred while retrieving KYB information.
Error occurred while retrieving KYB information.

put.summary: Submit a corporate customer application for review
put.description:
This API is used to submit a corporate customer application for review after all verification steps are complete.

**Workflow**:
- Ensure the application contains all mandatory fields in the required format, including user information, company information, documents, UBOs, and representatives (if applicable).
- After the required data is validated, the application will be submitted for internal review.

**Key Notes**:
- The application will be processed, and any missing or incorrect information will result in a validation error.
- Once submitted, no further updates will be allowed unless the application is returned for revision.
- The action finalizes the application and makes it ready for review by the designated team.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to Specifies the application version.

Application code used for validating application-based requests.

200.description: Corporate customer application submitted successfully for review.

400.description: Bad Request - Missing or invalid terms acceptance or incomplete application data.

post.summary: Create a password for the user after email verification
post.description:
This API allows the user to set their password after successfully verifying their email.
The user must provide the following details:
- The **temporary token** received after successful email verification.
- A new password that will be used to authenticate the user on future logins.

Upon successful creation of the password:
- The user’s password is saved securely in the system.
- The account is fully activated, and the user can log in using their new password.

If the temporary token is invalid or expired:
- The user will receive an error response indicating the failure.
- The password creation process will be aborted.

If the password doesn't meet the required security criteria:
- The user will be prompted to choose a stronger password.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to Specifies the application version.

schema.description: Partner code of this user.
Application code used for validating application-based requests.

value.message: Password should be at least 8 characters long and include a mix of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters for enhanced security.

post.description:
This API allows an authenticated user to change their existing password.

Requirements:
- The user must provide their current password for verification.
- A new password that meets the system's security criteria must be provided.

Upon successful password change:
- The new password will replace the existing password.
- The user can use the new password for future logins.

If the current password is incorrect:
- The user will receive an error response, and the password will not be updated.

If the new password does not meet security criteria:
- The user will be prompted to provide a stronger password.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to Specifies the application version.

schema.description: Partner code of this user.
Application code used for validating application-based requests.

value.message: Password should be at least 8 characters long and include a mix of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and special characters for enhanced security.

post.description:
This API allows a user to request a password reset link or token if they have forgotten their password.

Workflow:
- The user provides their registered email address.
- If the email exists in the system:
  - A password reset link or token is sent to the provided email.
  - The user can use this link/token to reset their password.
- If the email does not exist:
  - For security purposes, a generic success message is returned (to prevent email enumeration).

The email will contain:
- A secure token.
- Instructions to reset the password.

If the email sending fails:
- An error response will be provided.

Upon successful email delivery, the user will receive a confirmation response.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to Specifies the application version.

schema.description: Partner code of this user.
Application code used for validating application-based requests.

example.message: Error occurred while sending password reset link.

post.summary: Reset user password using a valid reset token
post.description:
This API allows a user to reset their password using the password reset token received in the password reset email.
Workflow:
- The user provides:
  - A valid password reset token.
  - A new password that meets the system’s security criteria.
- If the token is valid and not expired:
  - The user's password is securely updated in the system.
  - The token is invalidated to prevent reuse.
- If the token is invalid or expired:
  - An error response is returned.

Upon successful password reset:
- The user will be able to log in with the new password.

Security Considerations:
- The reset token must be validated for authenticity and expiration.
- The new password should meet all required security criteria.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user and customer are associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to Specifies the application version.

The wallet address is validated based on the chain type. Once validated, it's associated with the user's account and the provider's system.

**Key Notes:**
- The user must have a `Verified` status to add a new wallet.
- A user cannot add a wallet for a chain if one already exists.

walletAddress.description: The user's wallet address for the specified chain.

400.description: Bad Request due to validation errors or business logic constraints.

value.message: Wallet already exists for this chain

constraints.isAddress: Wallet Address must be a valid TRON address

423.description: Wallet address exist added on RAIN.

message.example: Cannot update wallet address for Tron chain since user has collateral contracts on Tron chains

get.summary: Retrieve user's available and activated chains
get.description:
This API returns a list of all blockchain networks available to the user through the partner. 
For each chain, it indicates whether the user has activated it by providing a wallet address.

**Headers**:
- **x-partner-code**: Identifies the partner to whom the user is associated.
- **x-app-code**: Used for authentication to validate application-based requests.
- **x-app-version**: Used to specify the application version.

schema.description: Partner code of this user.
Application code used for validating application-based requests.
The version of the application making the request.
Filter wallet on isEnabled

chainId.description: The unique identifier for the blockchain.

chainName.description: The human-readable name of the chain.

walletAddress.description: The user's wallet address for this chain, or null if not activated.

isEnabled.description: True if the user has a wallet for this chain, otherwise false.
